gr.forth.ics.graph.algo
Class DegreeSorter

java.lang.Object
  gr.forth.ics.graph.algo.DegreeSorter

public final class DegreeSorter
extends Object

A dynamic node partition of a graph based on node degrees. A BucketSort is attached to a particular graph and can be used to query nodes based on their degree. The type of the degree taken into consideration is customizable via a specified Direction, i.e. Direction.OUT means to use the out-degree of the nodes, Direction.IN the in-degree, and Direction.EITHER the total (in and out) degree (see #BucketSort(InspectableGraph, Direction).

The BucketSort automatically updates itself when the graph is modified, so it always represents the most up-to-date degree information of the graph.

Constructor Summary
DegreeSorter(InspectableGraph g)
          Creates a BucketSort attached on the specified graph, where the degree of each node is taken via InspectableGraph.degree(Node), i.e. undirected.
DegreeSorter(InspectableGraph g, Direction degreeDirection)
          Creates a BucketSort attached on the specified graph, where the degree of each node is taken via InspectableGraph.degree(Node, Direction).

Constructor Detail

DegreeSorter

public DegreeSorter(InspectableGraph g)
Creates a BucketSort attached on the specified graph, where the degree of each node is taken via InspectableGraph.degree(Node), i.e. undirected.

The BucketSort will update itself in response to graph modifications, so it always represents the most up-to-date state of the graph.

Parameters:
g - the graph of which to create a node partition based on the node degrees

DegreeSorter

public DegreeSorter(InspectableGraph g,
                    Direction degreeDirection)
Creates a BucketSort attached on the specified graph, where the degree of each node is taken via InspectableGraph.degree(Node, Direction).

The BucketSort will update itself in response to graph modifications, so it always represents the most up-to-date state of the graph.

Parameters:
g - the graph of which to create a node partition based on the node degrees
degreeDirection - defines the direction on which "degree" is defined.
  • Direction.OUT means out-degree of nodes,
  • Direction.IN means in-degree of nodes, and
  • Direction.EITHER means undirected degree of nodes
Method Detail

getNodes

public Collection<Node> getNodes(int degree)
Returns an unmodifiable collection containing all nodes of the graph with the specified degree. This operation is executed in O(1) time.

The graph and the meaning of the degree is specified in BucketSort constructors.

Parameters:
degree - the degree of the returned nodes
Returns:
all nodes of the graph with degree equal to the specified one

hasNodes

public boolean hasNodes(int degree)
Returns whether there are any nodes in the graph with the specified degree. Equivalent to !getNodes(degree).isEmpty().

Parameters:
degree - the required degree of nodes to check the existence of
Returns:
whether there are nodes in the graph with the specified degree

keySet

public Set<Integer> keySet()
Returns an unmodifiable set (in ascending order) with all the degrees that have at least one node.

Returns:
an unmodifiable sorted set (in ascending order) with all the degrees that have at least one node

getMinDegree

public int getMinDegree()
Returns the min degree for which there is at least one node.

Returns:
the min degree for which there is at least one node
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if there isn't any node in the graph

getMaxDegree

public int getMaxDegree()
Returns the max degree for which there is at least one node.

Returns:
the max degree for which there is at least one node
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if there isn't any node in the graph

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Returns whether there are no entries in this BucketSort (which implies that the graph is also empty, since it has no nodes).

Returns:
whether there are no entries in this BucketSort
